commands.name: cmdt generate field
commands.description: Generate a field for a custom metadata type based on the provided field type.

requiredFlags.name: --type
requiredFlags.description: Type of the field. You can't use this command to create a custom metadata type field of type "Metadata Relationship". Use the Salesforce Setup UI instead.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --picklist-values
optionalFlags.description: Picklist values; required for picklist fields.

optionalFlags.name: --decimal-places
optionalFlags.description: Number of decimal places to use for number or percent fields. The value must be greater than or equal to zero. Default value is 0.

optionalFlags.name: --label
optionalFlags.description: Label for the field.

optionalFlags.name: --output-directory
optionalFlags.description: Directory to store newly-created field definition files. New files are automatically created in the "fields" directory. The location can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory. The default is the current directory.

commands.name: cmdt generate fromorg
commands.description: Generate a custom metadata type and all its records from a Salesforce object.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

requiredFlags.name: --dev-name
requiredFlags.description: Name of the custom metadata type.

requiredFlags.name: --sobject
requiredFlags.description: API name of the source Salesforce object used to generate the custom metadata type.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --label
optionalFlags.description: Label for the custom metadata type.

optionalFlags.name: --plural-label
optionalFlags.description: Plural version of the label value; if blank, uses label.

optionalFlags.name: --visibility
optionalFlags.description: Who can see the custom metadata type. For more information on what each option means, see this topic in Salesforce Help: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.custommetadatatypes_ui_create.htm&type=5.

optionalFlags.name: --ignore-unsupported
optionalFlags.description: Ignore unsupported field types. In this context, "ignore" means that the fields aren't created. The default behavior is to create fields of type text and convert the field values to text.

optionalFlags.name: --type-output-directory
optionalFlags.description: Directory to store newly-created custom metadata type files.

optionalFlags.name: --records-output-dir
optionalFlags.description: Directory to store newly-created custom metadata record files.

commands.name: cmdt generate object
commands.description: Generate a new custom metadata type in the current project.

requiredFlags.name: --type-name
requiredFlags.description: Unique object name for the custom metadata type. The name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --label
optionalFlags.description: Label for the custom metadata type.

optionalFlags.name: --plural-label
optionalFlags.description: Plural version of the label value; if blank, uses label.

optionalFlags.name: --visibility
optionalFlags.description: Who can see the custom metadata type. For more information on what each option means, see this topic in Salesforce Help: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.custommetadatatypes_ui_create.htm&type=5.

optionalFlags.name: --output-directory
optionalFlags.description: Directory to store the newly-created custom metadata type files. The location can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory. The default is the current directory.

commands.name: cmdt generate record
commands.description: Generate a new record for a given custom metadata type in the current project.

requiredFlags.name: --type-name
requiredFlags.description: API name of the custom metadata type to create a record for; must end in "__mdt".

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --label
optionalFlags.description: Label for the new record.

optionalFlags.name: --protected
optionalFlags.description: Protect the record when it's in a managed package. Protected records can only be accessed by code in the same managed package namespace.

optionalFlags.name: --input-directory
optionalFlags.description: Directory from which to get the custom metadata type definition from.

optionalFlags.name: --output-directory
optionalFlags.description: Directory to store newly-created custom metadata record files.

commands.name: cmdt generate records
commands.description: Generate new custom metadata type records from a CSV file.

requiredFlags.name: --type-name
requiredFlags.description: API name of the custom metadata type to create a record for. The '__mdt' suffix is appended to the end of the name if it's omitted.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --input-directory
optionalFlags.description: Directory from which to get the custom metadata type definition from.

optionalFlags.name: --output-directory
optionalFlags.description: Directory to store newly-created custom metadata record files.

optionalFlags.name: --name-column
optionalFlags.description: Column used to determine the name of the record.
